thig3.5:1.1: “Mother, you cry in the forest for Jīvā.
thig3.5:1.5: were burnt in that cremation ground:
thig3.5:1.6: you sorrowed over all of them in the same way.”
thig3.5:2.1: “At last, you pulled out the thorn,
thig3.5:2.2: difficult to see, stuck in my heart.
thig3.5:2.3: Losing my daughter filled me with grief,
thig3.5:2.4: but now that grief is gone.
thig3.5:3.1: Today the thorn has been pulled out;
thig3.5:3.2: I am free of craving, fully quenched.
thig3.5:3.3: I go to the Sage for refuge
thig3.5:3.4: in the Buddha, Dhamma, and Sangha.”
